intro: Chrysobalanus pellocarpus, commonly known as the Brazilian walnut or yellow cedar, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive yellowish-brown bark. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by edible, orange-colored fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
